name: Take this The 2007 NFL Draft Quiz! Easy Trivia |       NFL Drafts and Trades

questions.text: With Brady Quinn almost predicting that he would be the number one overall pick, who did the Oakland Raiders pick first overall?
questions.explanation:
JaMarcus Russell.

	Although Quinn won the Maxwell Award (Player of the Year), the Raiders took Russell, a quarterback from LSU.

questions.text: With the second pick of the 2007 draft, the Detroit Lions took which player from Georgia Tech?
questions.explanation:
Calvin Johnson.

	The Lions went with the receiving hands of Johnson, to help Jon Kitna and the Lions' 3-13 2006 record.

questions.text: An offensive tackle in the name of Joe Thomas was picked third in the 2007 draft.  Which team picked him?
questions.explanation:
Cleveland Browns.

	This was a shocker to NFL fans, as they were positive that the Browns would take Brady Quinn.  In 2006, the Browns' quarterbacks totaled a TD/INT ratio of 15-25 combined.  The team sought and was in dire need of pass protection, which was the reason for their selection.  Thomas played college at Wisconsin.

questions.text: Surprising the world with the fourth pick of the draft, the Tampa Bay Buccaneers who weren't impressed with Cadillac Williams' running in 2006, picked which player position first in 2007?
questions.explanation:
Defensive end.

	Tampa Bay picked Gaines Adams, a defensive end from Clemson.

questions.text: The head office of the Arizona Cardinals promised quarterback Matt Lienart some pass protection for the 2007 season.  Their word was proven when they drafted which offensive lineman fifth overall?
questions.explanation:
Levi Brown.

	Brown earned his reputation and quarterback protection at Penn State.

questions.text: Who did the Washington Redskins pick with the sixth overall selection of the NFL draft?
questions.explanation:
LaRon Landry.

	Landry was a safety out of LSU.  Coach Joe Gibbs was instrumental and pushed this pick to help the Redskins' dismal defense of 2006.

questions.text: The 2007 NFL draft took six picks before they saw the first running back selected.  Which running back was this?
questions.explanation:
Adrian Peterson.

	Adrian Peterson was the Oklahoma running back.  By all odds, it was predicted that Peterson would go in the top three, but had to wait until the Minnesota Vikings picked him at number seven.

questions.text: The Atlanta Falcons, satisfied with Warrick Dunn's 1140 rushing yards in 2006, and the legs and arm of quarterback Michael Vick, went to the defense in the 2007 draft.  Who did the Falcons pick with the eight overall selection?
options: Nobody.  The Falcons traded the eighth overall draft selection to the Dallas Cowboys
questions.explanation:
Jamaal Anderson.

	The defensive end from Arkansas was selected to the first team All-SEC in 2006.  Anderson was actually a receiver in high school.

questions.text: When this player still was not selected by the eight overall pick, it took three of the allotted 15 minutes for the Miami Dolphins to make their pick.  They shocked all NFL fans with which pick?
questions.explanation:
Ted Ginn Jr.

	The Dolphins must have salivated heavily when nobody had touched Quinn, but at the time of the draft, the Dolphins were still in talks with quarterback Trent Green of the Kansas City Chiefs, thus passing up on Quinn, the quarterback from Notre Dame.  Ginn Jr was a wide receiver from Ohio State.  He was also a kick and punt returner.

questions.text: To round out the first ten picks in the 2007 NFL draft, it was the Houston Texans' turn.  Who gave a sigh of relief when his name was called?
questions.explanation:
Amobi Okoye.

	Brady Quinn, the quarterback from Notre Dame, watched in shock when the Texans took the defensive end from Louisville.
